function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of standards for publication","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of inaccurate medical information","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underreporting of covid-19 cases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of credibility","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-compliance with protocols","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited testing and treatment capabilities","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of mild or asymptomatic cases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misdiagnosis and fake news","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misdiagnoses, privacy breaches, equipment malfunction, costs","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on information technology, media, and research & development","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Professionals may not prioritize occupant health in building design and operation.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to musculoskeletal pain and mental health issues related to building design","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low level of experience in improving occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on large-scale datasets for ai models, which may not always be available or reliable.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of incorporation of domain knowledge in data-driven ai models leading to suboptimal performance in disease monitoring and control.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of antibacterial fabrics and finishes may lead to a false sense of security and reduce adherence to proper hygiene practices.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationship of the house with the exterior, including windows and balconies, has been important during the pandemic for visual and auditory socialization and well-being.","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as places for communication and social activities may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases between neighbors and residents.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cooperation and interaction in residential balconies can lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of privacy on the balcony may lead to behaviors that increase the risk of disease transmission, such as talking loudly and playing loud music.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of promoting graphene derivatives as a primary solution for virus destruction","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface modifications of graphene influencing antimicrobial activities and antiviral properties.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper dispersion of nanomaterials like graphene and mnps may lead to reduced antimicrobial activity, allowing pathogens to spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interaction between bacteria and gbns containing surfaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of rna and dna viruses","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modification of properties using polymeric material and mnps","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential contamination of graphene-based products with sars-cov-2 during manufacturing or handling","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete or insufficient inactivation of sars-cov-2 on graphene-based coatings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-reliance on nano-coatings for disease prevention","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges related to cost and processing of graphene-based coatings at different surfaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of paper sensor devices for rapid diagnosis of pathogens in untreated wastewater samples, including the use of pcr and paper-based devices.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in long-term planning for climate change impact on health in resource-limited settings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social science integration in disease control policies and programs","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Focus on single diseases in surveillance systems","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overlapping transmission of multiple parasitic or viral diseases by the same species of mosquito.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compartmentalized disease surveillance and reporting systems with fragmented international networks.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to the pervasive co-infection in neglected tropical diseases ntds .","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited investigation of potential interactions between people and triatomine bugs in different landscape fragments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumption of homogeneity in social representations and practices of people in geographic, cultural, and economic landscapes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Validation of results between disciplinary teams suggests potential biases and lack of alternative perspectives","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider interactions between distinct pathogens in a common host","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of co-infection in disease control and epidemiological modeling","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on coinfection and co-morbidity in existing disease distribution systems","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalization of existing disease patterns and organizational methods","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequalities at the local level and gatekeepers silencing community groups from participating and having a voice.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensive educational program emphasizing prevention and curative medicine","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community awareness about the relationships between vector-borne diseases vbds and social, environmental, and climatic determinants may hinder the effectiveness of community-based interventions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
